TextSection.Contents: Primary localized cutaneous nodular amyloidosis (PLCNA) is the most rare form of primary cutaneous amyloidosis a skin disease characterized by the accumulation of amyloid deposits in the dermis characterized clinically by yellowish waxy crusted nodules and papules on the face lower extremities trunk scalp and genitalia and histologically by the localized deposition of immunoglobulin-derived amyloid in the papillary dermis and subcutis. PLCNA can be associated with connective tissue disorders such as Sj√∂gren's syndrome and CREST syndrome.
